page.title: 02THE MALTINGS, THORPE
page.content: The Maltings were built in 1895 and the place was chosen because there aren't many people around. While malt is being made it smells a bit, so its better not to be near people. Another reason was the railway is next to it for taking it to the breweries. Being in East Anglia, this is where all the barley is grown from which the malt is made. There are 5 people employed at the Thorpe_le_Soken Maltings and the firm is the biggest employer in the village. The firm is part of a brewery company and the malt goes to their own breweries in Romford,Burton and Wrexham.Nowadays the malt goes by lorry not by rail.It used to be loaded on in sacks but now it goes in bulk by road. There are a lot of maltings in places like Ipswich and Bury St. Edmunds because East Anglia is such a good place for barley.
